news_header: Trami storm causes fatalities and disruptions in the Philippines.
news_text: At least 24 people have died in the Philippines due to the Trami storm, with most casualties occurring in Nagana. The storm has moved towards Luzon, leading to the closure of schools and administrative buildings. With winds reaching up to 160 km/h, Trami is expected to continue west towards the South China Sea. The Philippines typically experiences around twenty tropical storms each year, resulting in heavy rains, strong winds, and landslides.
